class_notes: At the individual, national and global level, we will examine the evidentiary support for regular physical activity in relationship to risk, prevention, and recurrence of non-communicable diseases (i.e., cancer, cardiovascular, diabetes, depression, and anxiety), as well as the negative significant health impact of physical inactivity and sitting. Students who enroll in this course should possess a strong curiosity in understanding physical activity/inactivity within a transdisciplinary, historical framework and beyond the established, traditional physical benefits of exercise or sport. Topics of investigation will be presented through a transdisciplinary perspective utilizing lectures and group discussions, individual and group projects, and community engagement.
course_description: Seminar on various human health topics.
